messages.subject: Re: Pepsi and Coke
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 02/14/2002 2:47:22 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... At the Coke Museum in Atlanta (which is a truly wonderous shrine to capitalism and
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 02/14/2002 2:47:22 PM Eastern Standard Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:


> Remember the "New Coke" debacle? I wasn't a big Coke drinker when they
> tried the new recipe, but I always relied on Coke and Ritz Crackers when I
> had a migraine. I was horrified they changed my medication like that, and
> relieved when they saw the error of their ways and brought back "Coke
> Classic." Was it a colossal mistake, or the cleverest marketing ploy in
> history??? (I vote mistake; I've met marketing people!)
>
>

At the Coke Museum in Atlanta (which is a truly wonderous shrine to
capitalism and all-around fun), New Coke is mysteriously abset (or hidden--we
looked).
Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
